1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

2.verse: To know wisdom and instruction,

3.verse: to receive instruction in wise dealing,

4.verse: to give prudence to the simple,

5.verse: Let the wise hear and increase in learning,

6.verse: to understand a proverb and a saying,

7.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge;

8.verse: Hear, my son, your father's instruction,

9.verse: for they are a graceful garland for your head

10.verse: My son, if sinners entice you,

11.verse: If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood;

12.verse: like Sheol let us swallow them alive,

13.verse: we shall find all precious goods,

14.verse: throw in your lot among us;

15.verse: my son, do not walk in the way with them;

16.verse: for their feet run to evil,

17.verse: For in vain is a net spread

18.verse: but these men lie in wait for their own blood;

19.verse: Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain;

20.verse: Wisdom cries aloud in the street,

21.verse: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out;

22.verse: “How long, O simple ones, will you love being simple?

23.verse: If you turn at my reproof,

24.verse: Because I have called and you refused to listen,

25.verse: because you have ignored all my counsel

26.verse: I also will laugh at your calamity;

27.verse: when terror strikes you like a storm

28.verse: Then they will call upon me, but I will not answer;

30.verse: would have none of my counsel

31.verse: therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way,

32.verse: For the simple are killed by their turning away,

33.verse: but whoever listens to me will dwell secure

1.verse: My son, if you receive my words

2.verse: making your ear attentive to wisdom

3.verse: yes, if you call out for insight

4.verse: if you seek it like silver

5.verse: then you will understand the fear of the Lord

6.verse: For the Lord gives wisdom;

7.verse: he stores up sound wisdom for the upright;

8.verse: guarding the paths of justice

9.verse: Then you will understand righteousness and justice

10.verse: for wisdom will come into your heart,

11.verse: discretion will watch over you,

12.verse: delivering you from the way of evil,

13.verse: who forsake the paths of uprightness

14.verse: who rejoice in doing evil

15.verse: men whose paths are crooked,

16.verse: So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman,

17.verse: who forsakes the companion of her youth

18.verse: for her house sinks down to death,

19.verse: none who go to her come back,

20.verse: So you will walk in the way of the good

21.verse: For the upright will inhabit the land,

22.verse: but the wicked will be cut off from the land,

1.verse: My son, do not forget my teaching,

2.verse: for length of days and years of life

3.verse: Let not steadfast love and faithfulness forsake you;

4.verse: So you will find favor and good success

5.verse: Trust in the Lord with all your heart,

6.verse: In all your ways acknowledge him,

7.verse: Be not wise in your own eyes;

8.verse: It will be healing to your flesh

9.verse: Honor the Lord with your wealth

10.verse: then your barns will be filled with plenty,

11.verse: My son, do not despise the Lord 's discipline

12.verse: for the Lord reproves him whom he loves,

13.verse: Blessed is the one who finds wisdom,

14.verse: for the gain from her is better than gain from silver

15.verse: She is more precious than jewels,

16.verse: Long life is in her right hand;

17.verse: Her ways are ways of pleasantness,

18.verse: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her;

19.verse: The Lord by wisdom founded the earth;

20.verse: by his knowledge the deeps broke open,

21.verse: My son, do not lose sight of these—

22.verse: and they will be life for your soul

23.verse: Then you will walk on your way securely,

24.verse: If you lie down, you will not be afraid;

25.verse: Do not be afraid of sudden terror

26.verse: for the Lord will be your confidence

27.verse: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,

28.verse: Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again,

29.verse: Do not plan evil against your neighbor,

30.verse: Do not contend with a man for no reason,

31.verse: Do not envy a man of violence

32.verse: for the devious person is an abomination to the Lord ,

33.verse: The Lord 's curse is on the house of the wicked,

34.verse: Toward the scorners he is scornful,

1.verse: Hear, O sons, a father's instruction,

2.verse: for I give you good precepts;

3.verse: When I was a son with my father,

4.verse: he taught me and said to me,

5.verse: Get wisdom; get insight;

6.verse: Do not forsake her, and she will keep you;

7.verse: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom,

8.verse: Prize her highly, and she will exalt you;

9.verse: She will place on your head a graceful garland;

10.verse: Hear, my son, and accept my words,

11.verse: I have taught you the way of wisdom;

12.verse: When you walk, your step will not be hampered,

13.verse: Keep hold of instruction; do not let go;

14.verse: Do not enter the path of the wicked,

15.verse: Avoid it; do not go on it;

16.verse: For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong;

17.verse: For they eat the bread of wickedness

18.verse: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn,

19.verse: The way of the wicked is like deep darkness;

20.verse: My son, be attentive to my words;

21.verse: Let them not escape from your sight;

22.verse: For they are life to those who find them,

23.verse: Keep your heart with all vigilance,

24.verse: Put away from you crooked speech,

25.verse: Let your eyes look directly forward,

26.verse: Ponder the path of your feet;

27.verse: Do not swerve to the right or to the left;

1.verse: My son, be attentive to my wisdom;

2.verse: that you may keep discretion,

3.verse: For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey,

4.verse: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood,

5.verse: Her feet go down to death;

6.verse: she does not ponder the path of life;

7.verse: And now, O sons, listen to me,

8.verse: Keep your way far from her,

9.verse: lest you give your honor to others

10.verse: lest strangers take their fill of your strength,

11.verse: and at the end of your life you groan,

12.verse: and you say, “How I hated discipline,

13.verse: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers

14.verse: I am at the brink of utter ruin

15.verse: Drink water from your own cistern,

16.verse: Should your springs be scattered abroad,

17.verse: Let them be for yourself alone,

18.verse: Let your fountain be blessed,

19.verse: a lovely deer, a graceful doe.

20.verse: Why should you be intoxicated, my son, with a forbidden woman

21.verse: For a man's ways are before the eyes of the Lord ,

22.verse: The iniquities of the wicked ensnare him,

23.verse: He dies for lack of discipline,

1.verse: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor,

2.verse: if you are snared in the words of your mouth,

3.verse: then do this, my son, and save yourself,

4.verse: Give your eyes no sleep

5.verse: save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,

6.verse: Go to the ant, O sluggard;

7.verse: Without having any chief,

8.verse: she prepares her bread in summer

9.verse: How long will you lie there, O sluggard?

10.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber,

11.verse: and poverty will come upon you like a robber,

12.verse: A worthless person, a wicked man,

13.verse: winks with his eyes, signals with his feet,

14.verse: with perverted heart devises evil,

15.verse: therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly;

16.verse: There are six things that the Lord hates,

17.verse: haughty eyes, a lying tongue,

18.verse: a heart that devises wicked plans,

19.verse: a false witness who breathes out lies,

20.verse: My son, keep your father's commandment,

21.verse: Bind them on your heart always;

22.verse: When you walk, they will lead you;

23.verse: For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light,

24.verse: to preserve you from the evil woman,

25.verse: Do not desire her beauty in your heart,

26.verse: for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread,

27.verse: Can a man carry fire next to his chest

28.verse: Or can one walk on hot coals

29.verse: So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife;

30.verse: People do not despise a thief if he steals

31.verse: but if he is caught, he will pay sevenfold;

32.verse: He who commits adultery lacks sense;

33.verse: He will get wounds and dishonor,

34.verse: For jealousy makes a man furious,

1.verse: My son, keep my words

2.verse: keep my commandments and live;

3.verse: bind them on your fingers;

4.verse: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”

5.verse: to keep you from the forbidden woman,

6.verse: For at the window of my house

7.verse: and I have seen among the simple,

8.verse: passing along the street near her corner,

9.verse: in the twilight, in the evening,

10.verse: And behold, the woman meets him,

11.verse: She is loud and wayward;

12.verse: now in the street, now in the market,

13.verse: She seizes him and kisses him,

14.verse: “I had to offer sacrifices,

15.verse: so now I have come out to meet you,

16.verse: I have spread my couch with coverings,

17.verse: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh,

18.verse: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning;

19.verse: For my husband is not at home;

20.verse: he took a bag of money with him;

21.verse: With much seductive speech she persuades him;

22.verse: All at once he follows her,

23.verse: till an arrow pierces its liver;

24.verse: And now, O sons, listen to me,

25.verse: Let not your heart turn aside to her ways;

26.verse: for many a victim has she laid low,

27.verse: Her house is the way to Sheol,

1.verse: Does not wisdom call?

2.verse: On the heights beside the way,

3.verse: beside the gates in front of the town,

4.verse: “To you, O men, I call,

5.verse: O simple ones, learn prudence;

6.verse: Hear, for I will speak noble things,

7.verse: for my mouth will utter truth;

8.verse: All the words of my mouth are righteous;

9.verse: They are all straight to him who understands,

10.verse: Take my instruction instead of silver,

11.verse: for wisdom is better than jewels,

12.verse: “I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,

13.verse: The fear of the Lord is hatred of evil.

14.verse: I have counsel and sound wisdom;

15.verse: By me kings reign,

16.verse: by me princes rule,

17.verse: I love those who love me,

18.verse: Riches and honor are with me,

19.verse: My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold,

20.verse: I walk in the way of righteousness,

21.verse: granting an inheritance to those who love me,

22.verse: “The Lord possessed me at the beginning of his work,

23.verse: Ages ago I was set up,

24.verse: When there were no depths I was brought forth,

25.verse: Before the mountains had been shaped,

26.verse: before he had made the earth with its fields,

27.verse: When he established the heavens, I was there;

28.verse: when he made firm the skies above,

29.verse: when he assigned to the sea its limit,

30.verse: then I was beside him, like a master workman,

32.verse: “And now, O sons, listen to me:

34.verse: Blessed is the one who listens to me,

35.verse: For whoever finds me finds life

36.verse: but he who fails to find me injures himself;

1.verse: Wisdom has built her house;

2.verse: She has slaughtered her beasts; she has mixed her wine;

3.verse: She has sent out her young women to call

4.verse: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”

5.verse: “Come, eat of my bread

6.verse: Leave your simple ways, and live,

7.verse: Whoever corrects a scoffer gets himself abuse,

8.verse: Do not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you;

9.verse: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser;

10.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,

11.verse: For by me your days will be multiplied,

12.verse: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself;

13.verse: The woman Folly is loud;

14.verse: She sits at the door of her house;

15.verse: calling to those who pass by,

16.verse: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”

17.verse: “Stolen water is sweet,

18.verse: But he does not know that the dead are there,

1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon.

2.verse: Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit,

3.verse: The Lord does not let the righteous go hungry,

4.verse: A slack hand causes poverty,

5.verse: He who gathers in summer is a prudent son,

6.verse: Blessings are on the head of the righteous,

7.verse: The memory of the righteous is a blessing,

8.verse: The wise of heart will receive commandments,

9.verse: Whoever walks in integrity walks securely,

10.verse: Whoever winks the eye causes trouble,

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,

12.verse: Hatred stirs up strife,

13.verse: On the lips of him who has understanding, wisdom is found,

14.verse: The wise lay up knowledge,

15.verse: A rich man's wealth is his strong city;

16.verse: The wage of the righteous leads to life,

17.verse: Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life,

18.verse: The one who conceals hatred has lying lips,

19.verse: When words are many, transgression is not lacking,

20.verse: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver;

21.verse: The lips of the righteous feed many,

22.verse: The blessing of the Lord makes rich,

23.verse: Doing wrong is like a joke to a fool,

24.verse: What the wicked dreads will come upon him,

25.verse: When the tempest passes, the wicked is no more,

26.verse: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,

27.verse: The fear of the Lord prolongs life,

28.verse: The hope of the righteous brings joy,

29.verse: The way of the Lord is a stronghold to the blameless,

30.verse: The righteous will never be removed,

31.verse: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,

32.verse: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,

1.verse: A false balance is an abomination to the Lord ,

2.verse: When pride comes, then comes disgrace,

3.verse: The integrity of the upright guides them,

4.verse: Riches do not profit in the day of wrath,

5.verse: The righteousness of the blameless keeps his way straight,

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright delivers them,

7.verse: When the wicked dies, his hope will perish,

8.verse: The righteous is delivered from trouble,

9.verse: With his mouth the godless man would destroy his neighbor,

10.verse: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices,

11.verse: By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted,

12.verse: Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense,

13.verse: Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets,

14.verse: Where there is no guidance, a people falls,

15.verse: Whoever puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer harm,

16.verse: A gracious woman gets honor,

17.verse: A man who is kind benefits himself,

18.verse: The wicked earns deceptive wages,

19.verse: Whoever is steadfast in righteousness will live,

20.verse: Those of crooked heart are an abomination to the Lord ,

21.verse: Be assured, an evil person will not go unpunished,

22.verse: Like a gold ring in a pig's snout

23.verse: The desire of the righteous ends only in good,

24.verse: One gives freely, yet grows all the richer;

25.verse: Whoever brings blessing will be enriched,

26.verse: The people curse him who holds back grain,

27.verse: Whoever diligently seeks good seeks favor,

28.verse: Whoever trusts in his riches will fall,

29.verse: Whoever troubles his own household will inherit the wind,

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,

31.verse: If the righteous is repaid on earth,

1.verse: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,

2.verse: A good man obtains favor from the Lord ,

3.verse: No one is established by wickedness,

4.verse: An excellent wife is the crown of her husband,

5.verse: The thoughts of the righteous are just;

6.verse: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,

7.verse: The wicked are overthrown and are no more,

8.verse: A man is commended according to his good sense,

9.verse: Better to be lowly and have a servant

10.verse: Whoever is righteous has regard for the life of his beast,

11.verse: Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,

12.verse: Whoever is wicked covets the spoil of evildoers,

13.verse: An evil man is ensnared by the transgression of his lips,

14.verse: From the fruit of his mouth a man is satisfied with good,

15.verse: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,

16.verse: The vexation of a fool is known at once,

17.verse: Whoever speaks the truth gives honest evidence,

18.verse: There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,

19.verse: Truthful lips endure forever,

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil,

21.verse: No ill befalls the righteous,

22.verse: Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord ,

23.verse: A prudent man conceals knowledge,

24.verse: The hand of the diligent will rule,

25.verse: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down,

26.verse: One who is righteous is a guide to his neighbor,

27.verse: Whoever is slothful will not roast his game,

28.verse: In the path of righteousness is life,

1.verse: A wise son hears his father's instruction,

2.verse: From the fruit of his mouth a man eats what is good,

3.verse: Whoever guards his mouth preserves his life;

4.verse: The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,

5.verse: The righteous hates falsehood,

6.verse: Righteousness guards him whose way is blameless,

7.verse: One pretends to be rich, yet has nothing;

8.verse: The ransom of a man's life is his wealth,

9.verse: The light of the righteous rejoices,

10.verse: By insolence comes nothing but strife,

11.verse: Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,

12.verse: Hope deferred makes the heart sick,

13.verse: Whoever despises the word brings destruction on himself,

14.verse: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,

15.verse: Good sense wins favor,

16.verse: Every prudent man acts with knowledge,

17.verse: A wicked messenger falls into trouble,

18.verse: Poverty and disgrace come to him who ignores instruction,

19.verse: A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul,

20.verse: Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,

21.verse: Disaster pursues sinners,

22.verse: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children,

23.verse: The fallow ground of the poor would yield much food,

24.verse: Whoever spares the rod hates his son,

25.verse: The righteous has enough to satisfy his appetite,

1.verse: The wisest of women builds her house,

2.verse: Whoever walks in uprightness fears the Lord ,

3.verse: By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,

4.verse: Where there are no oxen, the manger is clean,

5.verse: A faithful witness does not lie,

6.verse: A scoffer seeks wisdom in vain,

7.verse: Leave the presence of a fool,

8.verse: The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way,

9.verse: Fools mock at the guilt offering,

10.verse: The heart knows its own bitterness,

11.verse: The house of the wicked will be destroyed,

12.verse: There is a way that seems right to a man,

13.verse: Even in laughter the heart may ache,

14.verse: The backslider in heart will be filled with the fruit of his ways,

15.verse: The simple believes everything,

16.verse: One who is wise is cautious and turns away from evil,

17.verse: A man of quick temper acts foolishly,

18.verse: The simple inherit folly,

19.verse: The evil bow down before the good,

20.verse: The poor is disliked even by his neighbor,

21.verse: Whoever despises his neighbor is a sinner,

22.verse: Do they not go astray who devise evil?

23.verse: In all toil there is profit,

24.verse: The crown of the wise is their wealth,

25.verse: A truthful witness saves lives,

26.verse: In the fear of the Lord one has strong confidence,

27.verse: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,

28.verse: In a multitude of people is the glory of a king,

29.verse: Whoever is slow to anger has great understanding,

30.verse: A tranquil heart gives life to the flesh,

31.verse: Whoever oppresses a poor man insults his Maker,

32.verse: The wicked is overthrown through his evildoing,

33.verse: Wisdom rests in the heart of a man of understanding,

35.verse: A servant who deals wisely has the king's favor,

1.verse: A soft answer turns away wrath,

2.verse: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge,

3.verse: The eyes of the Lord are in every place,

4.verse: A gentle tongue is a tree of life,

5.verse: A fool despises his father's instruction,

6.verse: In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,

7.verse: The lips of the wise spread knowledge;

8.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord ,

9.verse: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord ,

10.verse: There is severe discipline for him who forsakes the way;

11.verse: Sheol and Abaddon lie open before the Lord ;

12.verse: A scoffer does not like to be reproved;

13.verse: A glad heart makes a cheerful face,

14.verse: The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge,

15.verse: All the days of the afflicted are evil,

16.verse: Better is a little with the fear of the Lord

17.verse: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is

18.verse: A hot-tempered man stirs up strife,

19.verse: The way of a sluggard is like a hedge of thorns,

20.verse: A wise son makes a glad father,

21.verse: Folly is a joy to him who lacks sense,

22.verse: Without counsel plans fail,

23.verse: To make an apt answer is a joy to a man,

24.verse: The path of life leads upward for the prudent,

25.verse: The Lord tears down the house of the proud

26.verse: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord ,

27.verse: Whoever is greedy for unjust gain troubles his own household,

28.verse: The heart of the righteous ponders how to answer,

29.verse: The Lord is far from the wicked,

30.verse: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart,

31.verse: The ear that listens to life-giving reproof

33.verse: The fear of the Lord is instruction in wisdom,

1.verse: The plans of the heart belong to man,

2.verse: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,

3.verse: Commit your work to the Lord ,

4.verse: The Lord has made everything for its purpose,

5.verse: Everyone who is arrogant in heart is an abomination to the Lord ;

6.verse: By steadfast love and faithfulness iniquity is atoned for,

7.verse: When a man's ways please the Lord ,

8.verse: Better is a little with righteousness

9.verse: The heart of man plans his way,

10.verse: An oracle is on the lips of a king;

11.verse: A just balance and scales are the Lord 's;

12.verse: It is an abomination to kings to do evil,

13.verse: Righteous lips are the delight of a king,

14.verse: A king's wrath is a messenger of death,

15.verse: In the light of a king's face there is life,

16.verse: How much better to get wisdom than gold!

17.verse: The highway of the upright turns aside from evil;

18.verse: Pride goes before destruction,

19.verse: It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor

20.verse: Whoever gives thought to the word will discover good,

21.verse: The wise of heart is called discerning,

22.verse: Good sense is a fountain of life to him who has it,

23.verse: The heart of the wise makes his speech judicious

24.verse: Gracious words are like a honeycomb,

25.verse: There is a way that seems right to a man,

26.verse: A worker's appetite works for him;

27.verse: A worthless man plots evil,

28.verse: A dishonest man spreads strife,

29.verse: A man of violence entices his neighbor

30.verse: Whoever winks his eyes plans dishonest things;

31.verse: Gray hair is a crown of glory;

32.verse: Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty,

33.verse: The lot is cast into the lap,

1.verse: Better is a dry morsel with quiet

2.verse: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully

3.verse: The crucible is for silver, and the furnace is for gold,

4.verse: An evildoer listens to wicked lips,

5.verse: Whoever mocks the poor insults his Maker;

6.verse: Grandchildren are the crown of the aged,

7.verse: Fine speech is not becoming to a fool;

8.verse: A bribe is like a magic stone in the eyes of the one who gives it;

9.verse: Whoever covers an offense seeks love,

10.verse: A rebuke goes deeper into a man of understanding

11.verse: An evil man seeks only rebellion,

12.verse: Let a man meet a she-bear robbed of her cubs

13.verse: If anyone returns evil for good,

14.verse: The beginning of strife is like letting out water,

15.verse: He who justifies the wicked and he who condemns the righteous

16.verse: Why should a fool have money in his hand to buy wisdom

17.verse: A friend loves at all times,

18.verse: One who lacks sense gives a pledge

19.verse: Whoever loves transgression loves strife;

20.verse: A man of crooked heart does not discover good,

21.verse: He who sires a fool gets himself sorrow,

22.verse: A joyful heart is good medicine,

23.verse: The wicked accepts a bribe in secret

24.verse: The discerning sets his face toward wisdom,

25.verse: A foolish son is a grief to his father

26.verse: To impose a fine on a righteous man is not good,

27.verse: Whoever restrains his words has knowledge,

28.verse: Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;

1.verse: Whoever isolates himself seeks his own desire;

2.verse: A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,

3.verse: When wickedness comes, contempt comes also,

4.verse: The words of a man's mouth are deep waters;

5.verse: It is not good to be partial to the wicked

6.verse: A fool's lips walk into a fight,

7.verse: A fool's mouth is his ruin,

8.verse: The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;

9.verse: Whoever is slack in his work

10.verse: The name of the Lord is a strong tower;

11.verse: A rich man's wealth is his strong city,

12.verse: Before destruction a man's heart is haughty,

13.verse: If one gives an answer before he hears,

14.verse: A man's spirit will endure sickness,

15.verse: An intelligent heart acquires knowledge,

16.verse: A man's gift makes room for him

17.verse: The one who states his case first seems right,

18.verse: The lot puts an end to quarrels

19.verse: A brother offended is more unyielding than a strong city,

20.verse: From the fruit of a man's mouth his stomach is satisfied;

21.verse: Death and life are in the power of the tongue,

22.verse: He who finds a wife finds a good thing

23.verse: The poor use entreaties,

24.verse: A man of many companions may come to ruin,

1.verse: Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity

2.verse: Desire without knowledge is not good,

3.verse: When a man's folly brings his way to ruin,

4.verse: Wealth brings many new friends,

5.verse: A false witness will not go unpunished,

6.verse: Many seek the favor of a generous man,

7.verse: All a poor man's brothers hate him;

8.verse: Whoever gets sense loves his own soul;

9.verse: A false witness will not go unpunished,

10.verse: It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury,

11.verse: Good sense makes one slow to anger,

12.verse: A king's wrath is like the growling of a lion,

13.verse: A foolish son is ruin to his father,

14.verse: House and wealth are inherited from fathers,

15.verse: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep,

16.verse: Whoever keeps the commandment keeps his life;

17.verse: Whoever is generous to the poor lends to the Lord ,

18.verse: Discipline your son, for there is hope;

19.verse: A man of great wrath will pay the penalty,

20.verse: Listen to advice and accept instruction,

21.verse: Many are the plans in the mind of a man,

22.verse: What is desired in a man is steadfast love,

23.verse: The fear of the Lord leads to life,

24.verse: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish

25.verse: Strike a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence;

26.verse: He who does violence to his father and chases away his mother

27.verse: Cease to hear instruction, my son,

28.verse: A worthless witness mocks at justice,

1.verse: Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler,

2.verse: The terror of a king is like the growling of a lion;

3.verse: It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife,

4.verse: The sluggard does not plow in the autumn;

5.verse: The purpose in a man's heart is like deep water,

6.verse: Many a man proclaims his own steadfast love,

7.verse: The righteous who walks in his integrity—

8.verse: A king who sits on the throne of judgment

9.verse: Who can say, “I have made my heart pure;

10.verse: Unequal weights and unequal measures

11.verse: Even a child makes himself known by his acts,

12.verse: The hearing ear and the seeing eye,

13.verse: Love not sleep, lest you come to poverty;

14.verse: “Bad, bad,” says the buyer,

15.verse: There is gold and abundance of costly stones,

16.verse: Take a man's garment when he has put up security for a stranger,

17.verse: Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man,

18.verse: Plans are established by counsel;

19.verse: Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets;

20.verse: If one curses his father or his mother,

21.verse: An inheritance gained hastily in the beginning

22.verse: Do not say, “I will repay evil”;

23.verse: Unequal weights are an abomination to the Lord ,

24.verse: A man's steps are from the Lord ;

25.verse: It is a snare to say rashly, “It is holy,”

26.verse: A wise king winnows the wicked

27.verse: The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord ,

28.verse: Steadfast love and faithfulness preserve the king,

29.verse: The glory of young men is their strength,

30.verse: Blows that wound cleanse away evil;

1.verse: The king's heart is a stream of water in the hand of the Lord ;

2.verse: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes,

3.verse: To do righteousness and justice

4.verse: Haughty eyes and a proud heart,

5.verse: The plans of the diligent lead surely to abundance,

6.verse: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue

7.verse: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,

8.verse: The way of the guilty is crooked,

9.verse: It is better to live in a corner of the housetop

10.verse: The soul of the wicked desires evil;

11.verse: When a scoffer is punished, the simple becomes wise;

12.verse: The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked;

13.verse: Whoever closes his ear to the cry of the poor

14.verse: A gift in secret averts anger,

15.verse: When justice is done, it is a joy to the righteous

16.verse: One who wanders from the way of good sense

17.verse: Whoever loves pleasure will be a poor man;

18.verse: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous,

19.verse: It is better to live in a desert land

20.verse: Precious treasure and oil are in a wise man's dwelling,

21.verse: Whoever pursues righteousness and kindness

22.verse: A wise man scales the city of the mighty

23.verse: Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue

24.verse: “Scoffer” is the name of the arrogant, haughty man

25.verse: The desire of the sluggard kills him,

26.verse: All day long he craves and craves,

27.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;

28.verse: A false witness will perish,

29.verse: A wicked man puts on a bold face,

30.verse: No wisdom, no understanding, no counsel

31.verse: The horse is made ready for the day of battle,

1.verse: A good name is to be chosen rather than great riches,

2.verse: The rich and the poor meet together;

3.verse: The prudent sees danger and hides himself,

4.verse: The reward for humility and fear of the Lord

5.verse: Thorns and snares are in the way of the crooked;

6.verse: Train up a child in the way he should go;

7.verse: The rich rules over the poor,

8.verse: Whoever sows injustice will reap calamity,

9.verse: Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed,

10.verse: Drive out a scoffer, and strife will go out,

11.verse: He who loves purity of heart,

12.verse: The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge,

13.verse: The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside!

14.verse: The mouth of forbidden women is a deep pit;

15.verse: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,

16.verse: Whoever oppresses the poor to increase his own wealth,

17.verse: Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise,

18.verse: for it will be pleasant if you keep them within you,

19.verse: That your trust may be in the Lord ,

20.verse: Have I not written for you thirty sayings

21.verse: to make you know what is right and true,

22.verse: Do not rob the poor, because he is poor,

23.verse: for the Lord will plead their cause

24.verse: Make no friendship with a man given to anger,

25.verse: lest you learn his ways

26.verse: Be not one of those who give pledges,

27.verse: If you have nothing with which to pay,

28.verse: Do not move the ancient landmark

29.verse: Do you see a man skillful in his work?

1.verse: When you sit down to eat with a ruler,

2.verse: and put a knife to your throat

3.verse: Do not desire his delicacies,

4.verse: Do not toil to acquire wealth;

5.verse: When your eyes light on it, it is gone,

6.verse: Do not eat the bread of a man who is stingy;

7.verse: for he is like one who is inwardly calculating.

8.verse: You will vomit up the morsels that you have eaten,

9.verse: Do not speak in the hearing of a fool,

10.verse: Do not move an ancient landmark

11.verse: for their Redeemer is strong;

12.verse: Apply your heart to instruction

13.verse: Do not withhold discipline from a child;

14.verse: If you strike him with the rod,

15.verse: My son, if your heart is wise,

16.verse: My inmost being will exult

17.verse: Let not your heart envy sinners,

18.verse: Surely there is a future,

19.verse: Hear, my son, and be wise,

20.verse: Be not among drunkards

21.verse: for the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty,

22.verse: Listen to your father who gave you life,

23.verse: Buy truth, and do not sell it;

24.verse: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice;

25.verse: Let your father and mother be glad;

26.verse: My son, give me your heart,

27.verse: For a prostitute is a deep pit;

28.verse: She lies in wait like a robber

29.verse: Who has woe? Who has sorrow?

30.verse: Those who tarry long over wine;

31.verse: Do not look at wine when it is red,

32.verse: In the end it bites like a serpent

33.verse: Your eyes will see strange things,

34.verse: You will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea,

35.verse: “They struck me,” you will say, “but I was not hurt;

1.verse: Be not envious of evil men,

2.verse: for their hearts devise violence,

3.verse: By wisdom a house is built,

4.verse: by knowledge the rooms are filled

5.verse: A wise man is full of strength,

6.verse: for by wise guidance you can wage your war,

7.verse: Wisdom is too high for a fool;

8.verse: Whoever plans to do evil

9.verse: The devising of folly is sin,

10.verse: If you faint in the day of adversity,

11.verse: Rescue those who are being taken away to death;

12.verse: If you say, “Behold, we did not know this,”

13.verse: My son, eat honey, for it is good,

14.verse: Know that wisdom is such to your soul;

15.verse: Lie not in wait as a wicked man against the dwelling of the righteous;

16.verse: for the righteous falls seven times and rises again,

17.verse: Do not rejoice when your enemy falls,

18.verse: lest the Lord see it and be displeased,

19.verse: Fret not yourself because of evildoers,

20.verse: for the evil man has no future;

21.verse: My son, fear the Lord and the king,

22.verse: for disaster will arise suddenly from them,

23.verse: These also are sayings of the wise.

24.verse: Whoever says to the wicked, “You are in the right,”

25.verse: but those who rebuke the wicked will have delight,

26.verse: Whoever gives an honest answer

27.verse: Prepare your work outside;

28.verse: Be not a witness against your neighbor without cause,

29.verse: Do not say, “I will do to him as he has done to me;

30.verse: I passed by the field of a sluggard,

31.verse: and behold, it was all overgrown with thorns;

32.verse: Then I saw and considered it;

33.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber,

34.verse: and poverty will come upon you like a robber,

1.verse: These also are proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied.

2.verse: It is the glory of God to conceal things,

3.verse: As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth,

4.verse: Take away the dross from the silver,

5.verse: take away the wicked from the presence of the king,

6.verse: Do not put yourself forward in the king's presence

7.verse: for it is better to be told, “Come up here,”

8.verse: do not hastily bring into court,

9.verse: Argue your case with your neighbor himself,

10.verse: lest he who hears you bring shame upon you,

11.verse: A word fitly spoken

12.verse: Like a gold ring or an ornament of gold

13.verse: Like the cold of snow in the time of harvest

14.verse: Like clouds and wind without rain

15.verse: With patience a ruler may be persuaded,

16.verse: If you have found honey, eat only enough for you,

17.verse: Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor's house,

18.verse: A man who bears false witness against his neighbor

19.verse: Trusting in a treacherous man in time of trouble

20.verse: Whoever sings songs to a heavy heart

21.verse: If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat,

22.verse: for you will heap burning coals on his head,

23.verse: The north wind brings forth rain,

24.verse: It is better to live in a corner of the housetop

25.verse: Like cold water to a thirsty soul,

26.verse: Like a muddied spring or a polluted fountain

27.verse: It is not good to eat much honey,

28.verse: A man without self-control

1.verse: Like snow in summer or rain in harvest,

2.verse: Like a sparrow in its flitting, like a swallow in its flying,

3.verse: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the donkey,

4.verse: Answer not a fool according to his folly,

5.verse: Answer a fool according to his folly,

6.verse: Whoever sends a message by the hand of a fool

7.verse: Like a lame man's legs, which hang useless,

8.verse: Like one who binds the stone in the sling

9.verse: Like a thorn that goes up into the hand of a drunkard

10.verse: Like an archer who wounds everyone

11.verse: Like a dog that returns to his vomit

12.verse: Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes?

13.verse: The sluggard says, “There is a lion in the road!

14.verse: As a door turns on its hinges,

15.verse: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish;

16.verse: The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes

17.verse: Whoever meddles in a quarrel not his own

18.verse: Like a madman who throws firebrands, arrows, and death

19.verse: is the man who deceives his neighbor

20.verse: For lack of wood the fire goes out,

21.verse: As charcoal to hot embers and wood to fire,

22.verse: The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;

23.verse: Like the glaze covering an earthen vessel

24.verse: Whoever hates disguises himself with his lips

25.verse: when he speaks graciously, believe him not,

26.verse: though his hatred be covered with deception,

27.verse: Whoever digs a pit will fall into it,

28.verse: A lying tongue hates its victims,

1.verse: Do not boast about tomorrow,

2.verse: Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;

3.verse: A stone is heavy, and sand is weighty,

4.verse: Wrath is cruel, anger is overwhelming,

5.verse: Better is open rebuke

6.verse: Faithful are the wounds of a friend;

7.verse: One who is full loathes honey,

8.verse: Like a bird that strays from its nest

9.verse: Oil and perfume make the heart glad,

10.verse: Do not forsake your friend and your father's friend,

11.verse: Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad,

12.verse: The prudent sees danger and hides himself,

13.verse: Take a man's garment when he has put up security for a stranger,

14.verse: Whoever blesses his neighbor with a loud voice,

15.verse: A continual dripping on a rainy day

16.verse: to restrain her is to restrain the wind

17.verse: Iron sharpens iron,

18.verse: Whoever tends a fig tree will eat its fruit,

19.verse: As in water face reflects face,

20.verse: Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied,

21.verse: The crucible is for silver, and the furnace is for gold,

22.verse: Crush a fool in a mortar with a pestle

23.verse: Know well the condition of your flocks,

24.verse: for riches do not last forever;

25.verse: When the grass is gone and the new growth appears

26.verse: the lambs will provide your clothing,

27.verse: There will be enough goats' milk for your food,

1.verse: The wicked flee when no one pursues,

2.verse: When a land transgresses, it has many rulers,

3.verse: A poor man who oppresses the poor

4.verse: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked,

5.verse: Evil men do not understand justice,

6.verse: Better is a poor man who walks in his integrity

7.verse: The one who keeps the law is a son with understanding,

8.verse: Whoever multiplies his wealth by interest and profit

9.verse: If one turns away his ear from hearing the law,

10.verse: Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way

11.verse: A rich man is wise in his own eyes,

12.verse: When the righteous triumph, there is great glory,

13.verse: Whoever conceals his transgressions will not prosper,

14.verse: Blessed is the one who fears the Lord always,

15.verse: Like a roaring lion or a charging bear

16.verse: A ruler who lacks understanding is a cruel oppressor,

17.verse: If one is burdened with the blood of another,

18.verse: Whoever walks in integrity will be delivered,

19.verse: Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,

20.verse: A faithful man will abound with blessings,

21.verse: To show partiality is not good,

22.verse: A stingy man hastens after wealth

23.verse: Whoever rebukes a man will afterward find more favor

24.verse: Whoever robs his father or his mother

25.verse: A greedy man stirs up strife,

26.verse: Whoever trusts in his own mind is a fool,

27.verse: Whoever gives to the poor will not want,

28.verse: When the wicked rise, people hide themselves,

1.verse: He who is often reproved, yet stiffens his neck,

2.verse: When the righteous increase, the people rejoice,

3.verse: He who loves wisdom makes his father glad,

4.verse: By justice a king builds up the land,

5.verse: A man who flatters his neighbor

6.verse: An evil man is ensnared in his transgression,

7.verse: A righteous man knows the rights of the poor;

8.verse: Scoffers set a city aflame,

9.verse: If a wise man has an argument with a fool,

10.verse: Bloodthirsty men hate one who is blameless

11.verse: A fool gives full vent to his spirit,

12.verse: If a ruler listens to falsehood,

13.verse: The poor man and the oppressor meet together;

14.verse: If a king faithfully judges the poor,

15.verse: The rod and reproof give wisdom,

16.verse: When the wicked increase, transgression increases,

17.verse: Discipline your son, and he will give you rest;

18.verse: Where there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint,

19.verse: By mere words a servant is not disciplined,

20.verse: Do you see a man who is hasty in his words?

21.verse: Whoever pampers his servant from childhood

22.verse: A man of wrath stirs up strife,

23.verse: One's pride will bring him low,

24.verse: The partner of a thief hates his own life;

25.verse: The fear of man lays a snare,

26.verse: Many seek the face of a ruler,

27.verse: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous,

1.verse: The words of Agur son of Jakeh. The oracle.

2.verse: Surely I am too stupid to be a man.

3.verse: I have not learned wisdom,

4.verse: Who has ascended to heaven and come down?

5.verse: Every word of God proves true;

6.verse: Do not add to his words,

7.verse: Two things I ask of you;

8.verse: Remove far from me falsehood and lying;

9.verse: lest I be full and deny you

10.verse: Do not slander a servant to his master,

11.verse: There are those who curse their fathers

12.verse: There are those who are clean in their own eyes

13.verse: There are those—how lofty are their eyes,

14.verse: There are those whose teeth are swords,

15.verse: The leech has two daughters:

16.verse: Sheol, the barren womb,

17.verse: The eye that mocks a father

18.verse: Three things are too wonderful for me;

19.verse: the way of an eagle in the sky,

20.verse: This is the way of an adulteress:

21.verse: Under three things the earth trembles;

22.verse: a slave when he becomes king,

23.verse: an unloved woman when she gets a husband,

24.verse: Four things on earth are small,

25.verse: the ants are a people not strong,

26.verse: the rock badgers are a people not mighty,

27.verse: the locusts have no king,

28.verse: the lizard you can take in your hands,

29.verse: Three things are stately in their tread;

30.verse: the lion, which is mightiest among beasts

32.verse: If you have been foolish, exalting yourself,

1.verse: The words of King Lemuel. An oracle that his mother taught him:

2.verse: What are you doing, my son? What are you doing, son of my womb?

3.verse: Do not give your strength to women,

4.verse: It is not for kings, O Lemuel,

5.verse: lest they drink and forget what has been decreed

6.verse: Give strong drink to the one who is perishing,

7.verse: let them drink and forget their poverty

8.verse: Open your mouth for the mute,

9.verse: Open your mouth, judge righteously,

10.verse: An excellent wife who can find?

11.verse: The heart of her husband trusts in her,

12.verse: She does him good, and not harm,

13.verse: She seeks wool and flax,

14.verse: She is like the ships of the merchant;

15.verse: She rises while it is yet night

16.verse: She considers a field and buys it;

17.verse: She dresses herself with strength

18.verse: She perceives that her merchandise is profitable.

19.verse: She puts her hands to the distaff,

20.verse: She opens her hand to the poor

21.verse: She is not afraid of snow for her household,

22.verse: She makes bed coverings for herself;

23.verse: Her husband is known in the gates

24.verse: She makes linen garments and sells them;

25.verse: Strength and dignity are her clothing,

26.verse: She opens her mouth with wisdom,

27.verse: She looks well to the ways of her household

28.verse: Her children rise up and call her blessed;

30.verse: Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain,

31.verse: Give her of the fruit of her hands,
